title: SequentialBreak: Large Language Models Can be Fooled by Embedding Jailbreak Prompts into Sequential Prompt Chains
subtitle: Privacy and Security of Large Language Models
coauthors: Md. Rafi Ur Rashid(Collaborator) - Pennsylvania State University, PA, USA
description: This research explores vulnerabilities in large language models (LLMs) by embedding adversarial jailbreak prompts within benign sequential prompt chains. Specifically, we demonstrate how harmful prompts, concealed within otherwise benign inputs, can bypass safety mechanisms and prompt LLMs to generate harmful responses. To address this issue, we introduce SequentialBreak, a novel attack technique that exploits the sequential processing nature of LLMs. We evaluate the effectiveness of SequentialBreak across leading LLMs, including Llama2, Llama3, Gemma2, Vicuna, GPT-3.5 Turbo, and GPT-4. Our findings underscore the critical need for more robust and resilient safeguards to enhance LLM security and mitigate potential misuse.

title: A Survey on Privacy, Security Attacks and Defenses of Multimodal and Vision Large Language Models
coauthors: Md. Rafi Ur Rashid(Collaborator) - Pennsylvania State University, PA, USA
Vishnu Dasu(Collaborator) - Pennsylvania State University, PA, USA
description: This ongoing collaborative research that surveys privacy and security vulnerabilities in multimodal and vision large language models (LLMs) and explores defense mechanisms. Key areas include adversarial attacks, image hijacking, jailbreak attacks, data poisoning, model inversion, membership inference, and backdoor attacks. Potential defenses, such as adversarial training, differential privacy and more will also be investigated

title: Deepfake Face Detection In The Wild
subtitle: IEEE Signal Processing Cup at IEEE ICASSP 2025
coauthors: Dr. Mohammad Saifur Rahman(Supervisor) - Professor - Bangladesh University of Engineering and Technology, Dhaka, Bangladesh
Sheikh Azizul Hakim(Co-supervisor) - Lecturer - Bangladesh University of Engineering and Technology, Dhaka, Bangladesh
description: This research is a part of an ongoing competition, IEEE Signal Processing Cup at IEEE ICASSP 2025. The research aims to develop a generalizable deepfake face detection model that can detect deepfake faces in the wild.

title: Methane plume detection, segmentation and flux rate quantification from multispectral satellite images using deep learning
subtitle: Undergraduate Thesis work [Manuscript in preparation]
coauthors: Dr. Tanzima Hashem(Supervisor) - Professor - Bangladesh University of Engineering and Technology, Dhaka, Bangladesh
Sultanul Arifin(Collaborator) - Lecturer - BRAC University, Dhaka, Bangladesh
description: The research aims to investigate attention Unet architechture that can detect, segment and probably quantify methane plumes from the Sentinel-2 multispectral satellite images. Hopefully, this lightweight solution would be able to monitor large-scale methane emissions globally from space and help us to tackle global warming.

title: Image Style and Modality Transfer using cycleGAN and its variants
subtitle: Machine Learning Sessional Project
coauthors: Md. Toki Tahmid(Supervisor) - Lecturer -  Bangladesh University of Engineering and Technology, Dhaka, Bangladesh
description: This sessional project aims to explore the capabilities of cycleGAN and its variants in style transferring images from MRI to CT and vice versa.
